param.name: +ellps=
param.label: Ellipsoid and Datum
param.help: The name of built-in ellipsoid definition. See https://proj.org/en/9.4/usage/ellipsoids.html#ellipsoids for more informations.

param.name: +lat_0=
param.label: Latitude
param.help: Latitude of natural origin, latitude of false origin or latitude of projection centre (naming and meaning depend on the projection method).

param.name: +lat_ts=
param.label: Latitude of true scale
param.help: Defines the latitude where scale is not distorted. Takes precedence over scale factor K if both options are used together.

param.name: +lon_0=
param.label: Longitude
param.help: Central meridian/longitude of natural origin, longitude of origin or longitude of false origin (naming and meaning depend on the projection method).

param.name: +x_0=
param.label: X
param.help: False easting, easting at false origin or easting at projection centre (naming and meaning depend on the projection method). Always in meters.

param.name: +y_0=
param.label: Y
param.help: False northing, northing at false origin or northing at projection centre (naming and meaning depend on the projection method). Always in meters.

param.name: +k_0=
param.label: scale factor K
param.help: Scale factor. Determines scale factor used in the projection.

param.name: +zone=
param.label: Select which UTM zone to use.

param.name: +south
param.label: South hemisphere.
param.help: Add this flag when using the UTM on the southern hemisphere.

param.name: +approx
param.label: approximation algorithm.
param.help: Use faster, less accurate algorithm for the Transverse Mercator.

param.name: +algo=
param.label: Selects the algorithm to use.
param.help: Default value is poder_engsager. When using auto, an heuristics based on the input coordinate is used to determine if the faster Evenden-Snyder method can be used for faster computation without causing an error greater than 0.1 mm (for an ellipsoid of the size of Earth)

param.name: +asc_lon=
param.label: Ascending Longitude
param.help: Longitude of the ascending node for the orbit (decimal degrees).

param.name: +inc_angle=
param.label: Inclination angle
param.help: Inclination (vertical tilt) of the orbit with respect to the reference plane, measured at the ascending node (decimal degrees).

param.name: +ps_rev=
param.label: Revolution time
param.help: Time required for a single orbit (days).
